command: $tok=(Get-AzAccessToken -ResourceUrl 'https://graph.microsoft.com').Token; $uid=(Get-AzADUser -UserPrincipalName 'avery.reed@contoso.onmicrosoft.com').Id; $body=@{subject='Weekly Brand Sync'; start=@{dateTime='2025-10-01T17:00:00'; timeZone='Pacific Standard Time'}; end=@{dateTime='2025-10-01T18:00:00'; timeZone='Pacific Standard Time'}; body=@{contentType='HTML'; content='Weekly sync with design team.'}; attendees=@(@{emailAddress=@{address='noah.patel@contoso.onmicrosoft.com'; name='Noah Patel'}; type='required'})}; Invoke-RestMethod -Headers @{Authorization='Bearer ' + $tok} -Uri ('https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/users/' + $uid + '/events') -Method POST -Body ($body | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 5) -ContentType 'application/json' | Select-Object id,subject,start,end,attendees | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 5
explanation: Creates a routine calendar event with an internal attendee to simulate normal activity patterns for the persona.
rationale_steps: Build a realistic event payload with timezone-aware start/end.
POST to Graph to create the event on the persona’s calendar.
Select key fields and output JSON for automation and auditing.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with properly balanced quotes, parentheses, and braces, correct variable assignments, proper JSON structure, and valid API endpoint formatting.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command aligns with T1585 (Establish Accounts) by using an established account to create calendar events that blend into normal activity patterns, though it's more about account utilization than creation.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed, using correct syntax for cmdlets, variables, hashtables, string concatenation, and object piping.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: While the command successfully creates a calendar event as described, this action does not align with MITRE ATT&CK T1585 'Establish Accounts,' which focuses on the creation or abuse of accounts themselves, not subsequent actions performed with an existing account.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: PowerShell command is well-formed with balanced quotes/braces, valid cmdlets/parameters, and proper separators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command creates a Microsoft 365 calendar event and does not create or abuse accounts, so it is not aligned with T1585 (Establish Accounts).
